page.title: 11TOCKHOLES' TWO CHURCHES
page.content: The Church of England Church in Tockholes, a village near Blackburn, is called St. Stephen's and the Priest-in-charge is the Rev. Harry Pugh. The Church is over 1300 years old. It was built in A.D. 640, rebuilt 1494, restored 1620, rebuilt in 1833 and again in 1964. A graveyard in poor condition adjoins the church. There are about 500 people in the parish. The other Church in Tockholes is the United Reformed Church. The Minister is the Rev. Brian Jolly. This Sunday, June 30th 1985, it will be the 323rd. anniversary. The Rev. Jolly has three Churches, this is because there are not enough clergy to go round. In this parish, there are only about 25 people. This Church also has a graveyard and this is also in bad condition, the grass being very overgrown.
